Piratini, May 29, 1837 — 2nd of Independence and of the Republic.

It is fitting to promptly promote, inside and outside the State, a loan of three hundred contos de réis in hard currency to cover the expenses of the defensive war that the valiant inhabitants of the Rio-Grandense Republic are nobly sustaining against the oppressive and unjust government of Rio de Janeiro, the President of the same Republic decrees:

Article 1 — The Minister and Secretary of State of the Treasury Affairs is authorized to contract, inside and outside the State, a loan of three hundred contos de réis in hard currency.

Article 2 — The capital loaned will yield interest of one and a half percent per month, or even less if possible.

Article 3 — The interest mentioned in the preceding article, plus ten percent more for gradual amortization of the capital, will be imperatively paid at the end of each year, until the complete repayment of the loan referred to in Article One, which shall not exceed a term of ten years, counted from the day the loaned amounts enter the Treasury.

Article 4 — It being to be expected that the Treasury’s condition will soon be in a position to face all the State’s expenses, not only by the austere method of oversight that is to be established in the Treasury Departments but also by their fair economy, should this be the case, the total sum of the loan and accrued premiums will be paid at the end of six years, counted from the date of the present decree.

Article 5 — In addition to the State’s revenues, the following national properties are mortgaged for the repayment of the present loan: Rincão de Saicã; that of El Rei in Rio Pardo; the Campo de Bojuru; that of the Countess of Real Agrado in Jaguarão; the estates of the extinct Missions; and all vacant lands that still exist in the State.

Domingos José de Almeida, Minister and Secretary of State of the Treasury Affairs, take it as understood and execute it with the necessary dispatches. José Gomes de Vasconcelos Jardim. Domingos José de Almeida. Publish and register. Piratini, May 29, 1837. Almeida.

Confirmed. The senior officer Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro.

[Annex to document CV-212]
